Trial_Design.evidence: This retrospective study included patients who had miniplates placed for BAMP treatment between January 2010 and April 2020

Participants.evidence: patients who had miniplates placed for BAMP treatment between January 2010 and April 2020 at the Department of Oral and Maxillofacial Diseases, Helsinki University Hospital, Finland

Intervention.evidence: The study group consisted of 164 miniplates in 42 patients, divided into two groups based on the operator: surgical residents (Group 1) and consultant surgeons (Group 2)

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to determine the failure rate of miniplates used in bone-anchored maxillary protraction (BAMP) treatment for skeletal Class III malocclusion and evaluate the influence of the surgeon's experience on the failure rate

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the failure rate of miniplates, measured over the treatment duration

Number_Analysed.evidence: The study group consisted of 164 miniplates in 42 patients

Result_Outcome.evidence: The overall failure rate of miniplates was 23.8% (39/164). The failure rate for Group 1 was 31.4% (27/86), while for Group 2, it was 15.3% (12/78) (p < 0.05)
